name: Rotarized
description: Shafts, Cranks, and gears, these are at the core of the machines of modern times and it's more important then that time to learn how to put those machines together. Join us as we explore the rotarized world

quests.name: Getting screwed
quests.description: Have you never found yourself putting up shelves in the middle of the night? Well this little device might not quite be sonic but it will be fantastic for reogranizing things.

tasks.longDescription: The screwdriver is the most basic and important tool that you will find when working with these HSLA steel machines. It will allow you to change their direction, or even change how they function. So keep this little thing handy.

quests.name: An Ogre made me do it
quests.description: To get started in the world of spinning and mechanical tomfoolery, it's best to start to work on the very basics of being able to make everything else don't you agree?

tasks.longDescription: Before you get started in full you're going to need a few items to help you along the way. These are reagents that you're going to be adding to a blast furance. So head out into the world and collect a few
Outside of just reagents you're going to need something else for your setup, this will end up getting placed under the blast furnace once you've made it.

Made with stone bricks and a bit of redstone the blast furnace is actually a fairly simple recipie but it will allow you to continue through the rest of your rotarized adventure in a most painless manner

quests.name: High Strengh Low Alloy
quests.description: So now that you have your furnace setup soemwhere nice, the next step is to actually start making the steel that we've been talking about. So throw some iron in there along with your reagents
prerequisites: An Ogre made me do it

tasks.longDescription: HSLA Steel (Don't worry we didn't know what it stood for either) will become the basis of your operation when it comes to rotaraized parts. With it everything else is possible and you're going to need a lot of it. As a heads up it takes a long while for the furnace to actually heat up

HSLA Steel much like the steel produced in other similar processes can be used for regular things as well, including the creation of a pickaxe. There's nothing too special about the pickaxe itself outside of being slightly more durable then it's iron counterpart
Finally you can also craft pieces of armor, they have the same approximate armor rating as their Iron counterparts, but again have a higher durability.

quests.name: The Assembly Room
quests.description: All of this is fantastic and great, but you're going to need a place to build it and a normal crafting bench just won't do the job. Instead we're going to need to rely upon the workstable

tasks.longDescription: The worktable isn't to tough to make, instead being made from Redstone, an existing workbench, A brick, some HSLA steel and slabs. It will be the device upon which virtually all constructed machines are built.

quests.name: Part: Part 1
quests.description: The following are going to be a string of quest that have you create the most basic parts needed to construct everything else.

tasks.longDescription: The gear is the most basic component that one can think of when they are dealing with these rotarized parts. Creating one is simple, simply place 5 HSLA steel in the crafting bench in a cross like formation.

Another core item on the linuep, the Shaft is what will be used for almost any and every instance of where you need to move around power. Crafing is simple as well, simply use 3 HSLA steel in a diagonal direction on the crafting square
The next invention is of course the panel, which again is used in a wide variety of recipies and is fairly simple to craft not unlike a slab made of any other material

quests.name: My First Engine
quests.description: Alright so you've started getting yourself together, you've learned to make a few parts but what about making something with all these parts? Well then it's time to make your first engine.

tasks.longDescription: The DC Engine is fairly simple to construct but more importantly then that it provides just enough power to run a pump and a few other items. So it is a great but simple start to your path.

quests.name: Pump it up!
quests.description: One thing that you'll always find yourself needing when you're making new and fantastical devices is a liquid to put into it. We're going to teach you what you need to make to do just that

tasks.longDescription: Alright look, we can teach you how to make a pump but what good is that going to do you if you don't have a pipe to put it in? Crafted with HSLA Steel and Glass this little pipe is perfect for getting water from point A. to Point B

The Pump itself doesn't require much in terms of power. A simple DC engine can run the device although a more powerful engine could run the pump faster, which is something you might which to keep in mind for bigger projects.

quests.name: The Windy City
quests.description: The DC engine is good for getting you through the day, but like any proper machinest you're probably looking for a better solution to your problems already. Why not call upon the infinite, renwable power of the wind?

tasks.longDescription: Before you can get started you're going to want to make yourself a propeller, these aren't actually all that difficult. Just needing some steel, a shaft, and a base panel.
The next item you should find can be constructed from parts you've already dabbled in. The hub has a lot of values, but here it's going to serve as the hub of our windy operations!

The Wind Turbine is an item that can be a bit tough to work with. First to be at full power it must be at or above Y = 128. In addition to this, the area in front of the fan must be clear for at least 16 blocks or it won't produce the proper amount of power.

quests.name: Part: Part 2
quests.description: This is a continuation of your little adventure into the world of part creation, again requiring nothing more then HSLA steel for the time being.

tasks.longDescription: Made with the Shaft units that you constructed in the last part of this little adventure as well as a single piece of HSLA steel in a diagnol shape on the crafting bench, this little item is fantastic for making your eventual mounts
The Ball bearing is crafed by putting 4 HSLA steel in 2x2 shape. It will make 16 of them, which is useful, but they tend to be an ingredient for other parts rather then a part themselves.
The Shaft bearing has some limited uses, but important ones. It is crafted by surrounding a piece of HSLA steel with some ball bearings.

quests.name: It's getting steamy in here
quests.description: So the DC Engine is great and all, but let's assume that you want even more powerful for the fantastical devices that you intend to create. Then it's time to learn about turning steam into Torque, power, and speed.

tasks.longDescription: The Steam engine is a little more complicated in it's construction, and you're probably going to want to put a piece of netherrack, or something that will burn reliabably underneath it to start powering it. Simply attach it to some water in the back and make sure there's a flame underneath it.

quests.name: Part: Part 3
quests.description: This is part of the continuning discovery documentary: Parts and what they're used for. My name is David Attnborough and here we can see the rear coupling of a condenser and an impeller

tasks.longDescription: Made with those liquid pipes you were discovering earlier and some HSLA steel, the Condenser has some limited uses but the most obvious of which will be in the creation of a steam engine.
The impeller is a simple device crafted by surrounding a gear with HSLA steel bars. This device has a wide range of uses and if you were going to start making a few it might be good to keep around.

quests.name: Moving Power - Chapter 1
quests.description: The next step along your journey is going to be getting all this power you're making with your various engines around the world like you would like. It's time to meet the methods for doing that

tasks.longDescription: The wood shaft is the most basic version and it comes with it's own flaws. There is a limited amount of power that it can run through the system, but at the same time it is the cheapest in terms of resources.

The stone shaft is much like it's brother in that it isn't quite the best shaft on the market that you can buy, but it's not the worst either. Requiring a few more resources then it's wooden counterpart the Stone shaft can transport a bit more power before it just explodes

Who doesn't love a bit of aliteration in the morning? The answer is of course noone not needing necessary nerdy nacelles. Hush you it doesn't have to make sense, but the Steel Shaft does. It's the steel standard if you will for transporting your various rotational energies from one point to another.

quests.name: Part: Part 4
quests.description: As you learn more about rotarizing your world it should grow increasingly apparent you're going to need more complicated parts to compose it. It's time to meet one of the most common parts in your arsenal.

tasks.longDescription: The mount is a device that will get used in virtually all of your shafts for getting power from point a to point b. It is a crucial recipie to get used to because you'll probably be making more then your fair share of them.
Though it has a very limited application the Wyrm gear can help in the construction of a device to convert speed and power into torque a bit inneffectively. Still it's important to know these things.

quests.name: Getting power places
quests.description: So we've learned about the shaft and a few other nifty tools, but that doesn't mean your wealth of knowledge is done. There is still yet more you can learn about the world

tasks.longDescription: A worm gear serves one purpose, to take a fair amount of power and speed and convert those into torque. In a great many ways it serves as a midway tool until you can get better equipment, but it's cheap and doesn't break without lube so there's that

The clutch is a wonderful device that acts a great deal like an on and off switch. If you give it redstone power, it is on, if you don't it is off. It's useful for those machines you only want running at particular times.

quests.name: No not the dating app
quests.description: There comes a time in every man, woman, and child's life when they look upon their inventory of metals and think to themsleves "This isn't enough" it is during those times that we invent the grinder.

tasks.longDescription: The Grinder is a device that requires at least a fair amount of power and in return it will crush the ore you feed it into a more particulate matter, in fact it may turn it into two of that particulate manner, each which reward you with a bar of what you were looking for.

quests.name: Extracting the Truth
quests.description: So sometimes simply grinding your metal up isn't enough, you also want to make sure to mix it and throw it in a slurry and so much more

tasks.longDescription: This little part is what you're going to need for making the extractor proper. It has a few other uses but it shouldn't be to tough to craft. As a heads up you can make better versions of this drill

The Extractor. It requires a fair amount of power, torque, and speed in order to function and has to be powered from the bottom. On top of all that it has to be given a supply of water to function, but there is a chance that it won't just double the amount of ore you get but even quadruple it.

quests.name: Firm in your belief
quests.description: It's time to learn how to make yourself the fuels of the future. Just shoving coal mixtures into a fire or steam aren't going to be enough to power the amazing engines of the future, now, you need more.

tasks.longDescription: Before you get all excited, you're going to want a few things to help you. These items are going to be required form the device we intend to make in order to make the "Stuff" you've always wanted.
The fermenter is a device that lets you brew on things for a while and you should respect it's amazing usefulness in the field. But for now we just need you to make one, then we're going to use it!

Yeast, can't live with it, can't live without it (Unless you love matzah). It's the wonderful product of all the work we have put into our fermenter so far, but it is but a simple ingredient for what we really want

quests.name: Brewing up a fire
quests.description: Now that you have your yeast, it's time to expand upon the buisness at hand to start brewing up (Or fermenting in this case) powerful additives that you can blow up and light on fire.

tasks.longDescription: Any plant bit will do, saplings, grass, food, something that grows in the ground into a bigger version of itself. So shove some plants, water, and yeast into that fermenter and find out what you get.
Alright so this stuff looks absolutely nasty right? Well we can't blame you for thinking that, this nasty little product doesn't seem good for much of anything, that is... until you light it on fire.
Throw your sludge into a furnace of some kind and let it cook and you might find that what was before a nasty pile of goop has formed into some perfectly good little explosively useful crystals.

quests.name: Changing Direction
quests.description: So you've found yourself being able to power things in a straight line, but how about when you want to change that corner, or even split the power into two directions, Well it's time to meet the tools to do just that

tasks.longDescription: The Bevel junction is unique, using the scrwedriver you can find out which color in the GUI Relates to which direction the gear goes. Keep in mind that you have to change the direction (No Top to Bottom).
Well the function is pretty clear. You can use this gear to either split or combine power and speed. Not that if you are going to combine two incoming inputs they have to be at the same power.

quests.name: Lubing it up
quests.description: A lot of the machines you are making are fine and dandy but without some oil keeping them lubricated they will soon break down. It's time to meet the Lubricants!

tasks.longDescription: Canola seeds can be found like many other seeds in the world, tilling a grass block. But these seeds are good for being turned into Canola oil, which makes a great lubricant for your machines.

When you're making a whole batch of lubricant, you're going to need a place to put it aren't you? Well in this case, that would be the job of the REsovioir, it's fantastic for storing just this sort of thing

Now to actually get the oil, you're going to have to throw the Canola seeds into a grinder, from there you will simply use this Lubricant hose to take it form the grinder to the approrpaite resovoir, and then from the resovoir to the various machines which need lubricant

quests.name: Terminal
quests.description: Alright so it doesn't use SSH, and you won't be getting a private key, but hey you do get a quick glance at your current power settings when attached to a exisiting rotarized infastructure

tasks.longDescription: When attached to the shaft it will read the power, speed, and torque that is going through it. It won't take any energy of it's own to run either and translates it directly to the output!

quests.name: Shifting Gears
quests.description: So why is it that we've had you harvesting Canola Plants? Well it's to get you started on the path to making your very own gear boxes. These little devices are like much better wyrmgears

tasks.longDescription: The first step to making a functioning gear box is of course making the gears that go in it. They come in different varieties and you can make more complicated gears by combinging them.

Now that you have the gears, you can make a 2:1 Gearbox. In this way it converts speed into torque The bigger the ratio the more speed is converted to Torque. These are the devices which must stay lubricated, if they aren't... they wear down. So be sure to connect a lubircant hose

quests.name: A little Gassy
quests.description: So you've made the ethanol, now it's time to burn it and make your very own super powered little system, isn't that right? Well not quite super powered, but ceratinly a bit of power

tasks.longDescription: The parts are a bit complex, but the function certainly isn't. Simply put ethanol in and your rotational energy will be coming right out!

So you've made some Ethanol, but we want this machine to be turbo powered do we not? Well then it's time to meet the performance engine... or rather the additives for it. It's going to need water and one of the three ingredients we've asked you to find.
Now you can mix the Ethanol, some water, and one of the additives. Redstone tends to be the best, followed by blaze powder, and fianlly gunpowder. With these you can give your engine a bit of a kick!

quests.name: Part: Part 5
quests.description: It's time for you to move on to the next piece of the part puzzle! These groups of parts are a little more technologically minded though.

tasks.longDescription: The Ignition unit, as you might imagine, ignites things. You'll mainly find this in devices which need to light fuel on fire in order to function, like gasoline engines by chance?
Made from HSLA steel, the cylinder is a fairly easy component to make. It has only one use though, and that's in the creation of a gasoline engine (Are you catching on to a theme?)
Made from Gold, Liquid Pipes, and HSLA steel. the Radiator is a good way to dissipate heat in theory, in practices it's main use tends to be in Gas powered engines and upgrades for those engines

quests.name: Waterworks
quests.description: It's time to learn a bit more about the field of green energy, or in this case we suppose you might call it blue energy... blue as in you're going to need diamonds.

tasks.longDescription: This is like a regular shaft core, excpet that you're going to need diamonds. Note that these can work with more torque, speed, and power without exploding. To make one you'll need a diamond shaft unit
You might remember that spring steel ingot we had you make earlier? Well you're going to use that in combination with base panels to create your Paddle Panels
So to make this little piece it's pretty simple. Take all those paddle panels and wrap them around a diamond core. Easy right? You can connect up to 4 of these.

quests.name: Praise the Sun!
quests.description: Bless the sun in all it's power, it is a glorius thing but more then that, while it is up, it's also a potential source of untapped power, and you can't really say no to that now can you?

tasks.longDescription: These solar panels need to be directly attached to the next item we're going to make. As the sun moves through the sky so do they to reflect the sun at the tower.

The solar tower will need water to function and the solar panels to redirect sunlight to heat up that water. The more of either means more overall output. Keep in mind if you fall from a high enough height onto a mirror it may break it. ALSO if you get enough mirros you might catch everything on fire.

quests.name: Part: Part 6
quests.description: The part time adventure continues as we start trying to figure out the parts that we'll need to make the machines of our dreams, the most powerful compotents in our rotarized arsenel yet.

tasks.longDescription: Made with HSLA Steel, an Igniter, and some redstone, the combuster has quite a few uses, though it's more famous one might just be in a piece of jet technology
It has any number of uses, the compressor is good for any number of things, and fairly easy to make. You just need to surround a gear with HSLA steel

Useful in a select set of tools, and an even more select set of devices, the diffuser is very simple to make, a sideways v on the crafting table with HSLA steel. Perhaps it's most well known use is as the nozzle for a Jetpack.

quests.name: Pulse Power
quests.description: The future production line is going to require some oddly specific parts, and sometimes the only way to make those parts is a little thing called Funneling jet fuel through a tiny nozel to melt it

tasks.longDescription: A few things to note about this little device, Don't let it get above 1,000 Degrees, make sure it has water and plenty of speed. (Don't worry about torque). It can melt tools and even obsidian... into something you might need.
Blast glass comes from Obsidian being melted in the Jet Pulse Furnace. Most importantly perhaps it is immune to TNT, and it finds itself as a component of more then a few pieces.

quests.name: Fueling The Future
quests.description: Ethanol is nice, but have you ever wanted something more powerful then that? Don't lie of course you have. It's time to get your introduction to jet fuel.

tasks.longDescription: The fuel line unlike the Lubricant Hose and the Liquid pipe is specialized to carry fuels and keep those dangerous fumes from escaping. As such the only way to move fuel around safely is through these little pipes.
The fractration unit is going ot be your key to the creation of useable jet fuel. Be warned though the ingredients to get this paticular item working are not easy to find.
The nether dust needs netherrack to be run through a grinder while the Tar dust will require soul sand to be put through another. All in all the returns may be worth it though.

quests.name: Am I that Vain?
quests.description: You ever find yourself staring at a mirror? Pretty hard to resist admiring yourself right? Well we're going to teach you to make your very own minecraft mirror

tasks.longDescription: This doesn't exactly seem mirror related, but trust us this little part will end up in a lot of places. You should definately get familiar with them. They just require steel, gold, redstone and an ender eye
These luckily require only iron and Glass, and you can look at yourself in them for the entire day and no one will judge you
These little mirrors can be used to turn the power of the sun and redirect it. Point it at something that is undead and you can even use that power of the sun to burn right through them.

quests.name: The Name is bond
quests.description: Who hasn't dreamed of being able to fly about the world, truely exploring everything around you? Well it's time to meet the tool, or should we say perhaps tools to make that all possible.

tasks.longDescription: This is our starter jetpack, you put in fuel, and it makes you fly. It's a simple enough concept right? WEll did you know there is more to it then that? Oh yeah it's time to get excited!

When building your jetpack you should know that you can build addons to your little jetpack, (Pretty awesome right? Yeah we thought so) here are just two of those sample upgrades. One to make it like armor and the other so that you can conserve a bit of fuel.

Now that you've got your armor and your fins it's time for even more. It's best to get the little glider wing on there and set yourself up a fueling station. Pretty cool litte trick eh? And not too tought to build either.

quests.name: Distilled Energy
quests.description: Ever wanted to turn rock into lava? Well it's time to meet that method. We're going to teach you how to convert your cobblestone into an even more valuable resource, Molten lava.

tasks.longDescription: By providing the Rock melter with power and a fuel source (in this case cobblestone, or nether) you can convert it into something even better, molten lava.

More then lava, the rock melter can also be used to turn those ethanol crystals that you were making into a more liquid and user friendly source. So throw them in and melt them and see if you can't get yourself a bucket of gas

quests.name: Turbo Mode
quests.description: Now that you've gotten into the world of gas and jet fuel, it's time to start learning how best to make use of them. Keep in mind that these machines down power up instantly and require a lot of fuel

tasks.longDescription: The Microturbine has a unique property in that it does not put out much torque but it puts out a tremendous amount of power. With a few gearboxes, you'll find they are perfect for bedrock breakers

Don't get in front of it, as it is a turbine and it will suck you right through. But what's the great thing about it? Well for one it's probably one of the few items that can run the extractor all on its own. It has a massive amount of power, torque, and speed
Control is more then something blue decks do, it's what this little unit does as well. Placing it under an engine you can give up a little speed in exchange for fuel effeciency

quests.name: Induction Junction
quests.description: You've reached a level of technology where the parts we have just aren't going to cut it anymore. They're going to need to be augmented with strange and new metals

tasks.longDescription: Alright so to get your indcutive blend you're going to need to do something, and that something is combining some gold grit or flakes with redstone. We're off to an easy start right?
Now to make the ingot you're going to want to put your special blend in that pulse jet furnace that you made earlier. It's the only way to get what you're looking for.
Now that you have your ingots you might find you have a whole new world of items to make with it. It's time to really dig deep and see what all has been opened up to you.

quests.name: Conversion Ratio
quests.description: You might be asking yourself just how to go from the series of Rotarized componets you've built to another form of power like those used by power lines and the like. Well it's time to meet your tools

tasks.longDescription: Gold is an excellent conducter, and is it turns out one of the key ingredients in this gold coil. Surround some HSLA steel with gold and you'll have what you're looking for
This machine specializes in transforming RF from other systems you may have up and running into a rotary friendly format. Connect your Hemp wrapped windmill to this puppy and watch it go
This engine happens to do just the reverse of the previous, converting Rotational power into RF so that everyone is happy.

quests.name: Part: Final Part
quests.description: It's time to learn about the final part in the part series. These little pieces should give you nearly all the information you will ever need to complete just about anything you can dream of that runs on some kind of rotarized power

tasks.longDescription: These little pieces find themselves putting a stop to the works, the part is simple enough to make with some bearings, some shafts, and of course a bit more. Great for making some industrial coils

One might go on to call this the key component in the system that you'll come to know and love, that is to say the industrial coil. Don't be afraid to build a few once you've got this part in your line up

quests.name: Misc'ed Oppertunities
quests.description: We wanted to cover with you just a few more perhaps random but important pieces of technology for the transporation of power across your rotarized network.

tasks.longDescription: It's great to have all this power, but what if you want to store it for later? That is where the industrial coil can come in handy. You can send power to it, and it will be stored, not unlike a bat box or capacitor in other mods.

The Flywheel works almost like a short term backup battery. In that you can give it power and it will remain on for some time after it loses power. Be careful though, give it to much power and it may just explode

So you're getting tired of having to use those shafts to always transmit your power? Well what if we told you that you could use a belt? By connecting two belt hubs with a series of belts (Right click one then right click the other and the appropriate number of belts will be used) you can transmit your power more easily over long distances

quests.name: Bedrock Breaking
quests.description: Alright so there's always been one thing between you and the edge of eternity, and it's the bedrock, you wanna learn how to break that too?

tasks.longDescription: You might find when you are running your iron through the Extractor that you have just a tiny chance of pulling out some tungsten. Well now it's time to learn how to use it, don't you agree?

Meet the Bedrock breaker, it happens to be the key to this entire operation, and you can bet that it requires a HUGE amount of power in order to function. A microturbine with a few gearboxes might do the trick for just one. Note it will not remove the bottom layer of bedrock (just to keep you safe)
It's like black gold, but even better then that this little spec of dust can open up whole new possibilities. Who needs diamond when you can use the substance that even diamond can't break?

quests.name: Just a bit of Friction
quests.description: One of the most traditional ways for making something hotter was to rub two sticks together, well we're taking that technology to the next level with the friction heater, which every home should have.

tasks.description: You rub me the right way
tasks.longDescription: When attached to the side of a Furnance the Friction heater can use power, torque, and speed provided by an engine of some kind to help make heating up things in the furnace a bit faster and without the need for fuel.

If you've ever gone into your own tree cutting industry you know there's know fun in having to cut them down yourself. It's time to meet the woodcutter, a fantastic device for felling a tree in your tree farm setups.

Requiring not that much in terms of parts or pieces, the item vaccum will use just a hint of power to bring in nearby items to it's own inventory. So say if you wanted to collect the wood from your woodcutter... or maybe the saplings.

quests.name: Bedrock Properties
quests.description: Alright we know your dying to make bedrock tools, so it's time to learn exactly what you need to do it. You ready? Of course you are, so let's dive right in!

tasks.longDescription: Combine a little bedrock dust with some HSLA steel in a blast furnance and soon you'll find yourself with a bedrock ingot, (Simple enough right). Make sure it's plenty hot.

Alright so now you've got the ingots, it's time to make something cool with them don't you agree? Well you'll be happy to know that these tools are enchanted with their own powerful set of enchants right out of the gate. Expirment to learn what all of them are.

quests.name: Gardening Apperal
quests.description: While you're out growing Canola seeds, you might wish to consider some more ways to make your garden a more easily managed location. We're going to teach you some nifty tricks for just such an occasion.

tasks.longDescription: The breeder should be fairly clear and to the point. You load it up with the food you would use to feed animals, and it dispenses that food so that they will... do what animals do. Remember though it will need power from the bottom

Want to attract some endermen by chance? Well it's time to learn about the bait box. Each mob has things it likes and dislikes putting them in the box will either attract or scare them off. Like the breeder it needs power
Piping a little water and then depending on the item giving them some power can help turn these systems into powerful ways to grow crops fater, expiriment a little!

quests.name: It's getting hot in here
quests.description: No you don't need to take off all your clothes, but it might because of the technologies we're about to teach you about!

tasks.longDescription: Control your tempature, the heater is designed to take the fuels that you feed it and then heat up to your specified amount. This way you can heat up a machine without accidently blowing it up when things get to hot

Using an ignitier, the mob harvester will allow you to deal damage to mobs based no how much power you give it so long as the mob is directly on top of it, in addition when they die, they will be killed as if a player killed them so they will drop that special loot
No more tricks with light, no more strange techniques to control your spawner. This device allows you to assume direct control over it. You can disable it, or change the spawn rate.

quests.name: Power Storage
quests.description: Sometimes a chest just won't cut it, but what if you could feed a chest so much power that it actually got bigger on the inside?

tasks.longDescription: The Scaleabe chest is a wonderful thing. The more power that you feed it, the bigger that it gets, and if you don't have enough power it simply doesn't let you access the thing in those later slots. It's great for having a huge space to shove stuff

quests.name: Cooking up differently
quests.description: HSLA Steel isn't actually the only thing that your new fancy furnace can cook up. In fact it has a few other tricks up it's sleeve.
prerequisites: An Ogre made me do it

tasks.longDescription: This paticular recipie has a much simpler calling. The only requirement is to throw some coal into the furnance and make sure it is at at least 400 Degrees. No additives required
This set of seemingly wound up steel can be gotten by heating up your furnance even more (You might have to find some things further down the line) and adding coal coke and redstone as additives.
